page.title: 04A COUNTRY ROAD
page.content: At the side of the road is a grass verge 2 metres wide which is regularly cut by the Council to improve motorists vision. Grasses,clover,dandelions and many other wild plants grow on it.By the side of it is a ditch 0.5 metres wide for drainage.The road is wide enough for two vehicles to pass,one in each direction.In a survey we found that cars were the vehicles that used the road most,but there were also some lorries going to a local Depot.The colour of road signs is white with black writing and a red surrounding.To separate vehicles going different ways there are white lines,5 metre lines with a 2 metre gap apart down the middle of the road.The road surface is made of small stones,stuck together with tar which is known as Tarmacadam.
